detaileddescription.para: power supply 2v5 register
power supply 3v3 register

briefdescription.para: Initialize the ADC interface for the analog measurements.
Initializes the Board part of the BURTC peripheral.
Provide a delay in millisecond.
Disables the 3V3 power rail.

detaileddescription.para: This function holds a register of the connected peripherals to the power supply and if a peripheral requests disabling it, the corresponding bit field is Reset and the register and if this register equals zero then the power rail is safe to be disabled.

parameterdescription.para: : enumerated value representing the peripheral requesting the Disabling of the power supply

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Enables the 3V3 power rail.

detaileddescription.para: This function holds a register of the connected peripherals to the power supply and if a peripheral requests enabling it, the MCU output enabling the Power rail is Set its and the corresponding peripheral bit field is Set

parameterdescription.para: : enumerated value representing the peripheral requesting the Enabling of the power supply

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Provide a tick value in millisecond.
Initialization of critical GPIO pins.
Function calls users callback for registered pin interrupts.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when GPIO interrupts are handled by the dispatcher. Function gets even or odd interrupt flags and calls user callback registered for that pin. Function iterates on flags starting from MSB.

parameterdescription.para: Interrupt flags which shall be handled by the dispatcher.

briefdescription.para: Returns the callback pointer.

detaileddescription.para:
This function is used to query the callback function registered for the requested pin.
pin
The pin number.
The callback pointer.

briefdescription.para: Initialization of GPIO Interrupts.
Registers user callback for given pin number.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to register a callback which shall be called upon interrupt generated from given pin number (port is irrelevant). Interrupt itself must be configured externally. Function overwrites previously registered callback.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the I2C interface for the sensor node.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the I2C interface to the default values for the extension board.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This function is called to increment a global variable "BSP_Tick" used as application time base.

simplesect.para: In the default implementation, this variable is incremented each 1ms in SysTick ISR.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the Board part of the RTC peripheral.
Puts the 2V5 power rail on low power mode(snooze).

detaileddescription.para: This function holds a register of the connected peripherals to the power supply and if a peripheral requests disabling it, the corresponding bit field is Reset and the register and if this register equals zero then the power rail is safe to be scaled down.

parameterdescription.para: : enumerated value representing the peripheral requesting the Snoozing of the power supply

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the UART interface for the bluetooth module.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the UART interface to the default values for the extension board.

detaileddescription.para:
The default values for the UART1 interface mapped to the extension board depending on which extension board is used this UART gets its configuration values from BoardExtSettings.h file. 115200baud
RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the USART interface at default SPI mode for the wifi module.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the USART interface at the default values for the for the SD_Card.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_OK in case of success error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the USB interface.
Performs operations prior to SysTick count increment.

detaileddescription.para:
This function is initialized during BSP_Board_OSTickInitialize() and makes it possible for the application to perform some operations before the SysTick counter is incremented (e.g. context switching in OS based applications)
This function is called in SysTick_Handler() function in IrqHandler.c file Wakes up the 2V5 power rail

This function holds a register of the connected peripherals to the power supply and if a peripheral requests enabling it, the MCU output enabling the Power rail is Set its and the corresponding peripheral bit field is Set

parameterdescription.para: : enumerated value representing the peripheral requesting the Enabling of the power supply

briefdescription.para: Controls the on-board power rails.

detaileddescription.para: : provided that there are controllable power rails on the board, the BSP will provide the necessary commands that are possible to have in order to control them safely.

parameterdescription.para: the desired power rail command implemented by the BSP.
in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Provide accurate delay based on variable incremented.

simplesect.para: Refer to your implementation for time granularity details.

briefdescription.para: Returns the power-supply mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function detects whether the MCU is being supplied using a battery or using an external power supply.

briefdescription.para: Disable the Core SysTick.
Enable the Core SysTick.
Returns the BSP Revision.
Returns the last wake-up source.

detaileddescription.para: This function will return the last event that resulted in the wake-up of the MCU from a sleep/deep-sleep state.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the entire board.

detaileddescription.para: This function is responsible of setting the initial configuration at the MCU and board level in order to establish a running state and perform basic operations.

The MCU resources are at this time configured according to their use cases and shut-down in order to maintain a low power consumption. As an example for a UART interface the BSP_Board_Initialize(param1, param2) will set the baudrate, the parity, the number of data bits, the number of stop bits, etc. and then disables the UART and turns off its clock.

parameterdescription.para: : Initialization parameter depending on the implementation, can be used to indicate type of param2.
: Initialization parameter depending on the implementation.
in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Initializes pre/post tick increment processing in OS based applications.

detaileddescription.para:
If an operating system needs to perform some operations before and/or after the system tick count is incremented the application needs to call this function and provide the callbacks which are called before and after the tick increment.
preCallback
A pointer to the function which the system needs to execute before incrementing the tick count of the system tick.
If no pre-processing is needed provide NULL.
postCallback
A pointer that points to the function which the system needs to execute after incrementing the tick count of the system tick.
If no post-processing is needed provide NULL.

briefdescription.para: Passes delay function from OS to BSP.

detaileddescription.para: If the application needs to replace the blocking delays greater than 50ms with non blocking delays it has to assign the delay function to this function pointer.
In general the delays implemented have 1 ms granularity.

briefdescription.para: Invoke Board Soft Reset. This puts the MCU registers to appropriate state applicable for soft reset. Please note this is not equivalent to hard reset.
Switches between different power modes.

detaileddescription.para:
This function is responsible of preparing switching between the available MCU power modes if the transition from the current mode to the next mode is allowed. Depending on the selected mode this function implements the recovery routines in order to bring the system to the state before it switched to that power mode.
powerMode
32 bit value designating the desired power mode according to what is specified in the implementation under BSP_BoardType.h
RETCODE_OK
in the case of success or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Implementation of Board BSP functions.
